action.action-desc: Mr. Faso (for himself, Mr. Collins of New York, and Mr. Stivers) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Home Owners’ Loan Act to allow mutual holding companies to clarify requirements related to the waiver of dividends, and for other purposes.

section.header: Dividend waiver authority for mutual holding companies
section.text: Section 10(o)(11) of the Home Owners’ Loan Act (12 U.S.C. 1467a(o)(11)) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (i), by adding and at the end;
in clause (ii), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: by amending subparagraph (E) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The appropriate Federal banking agency may not consider waived dividends in determining an appropriate exchange ratio in the event of a full conversion to stock form.

paragraph.text: by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: Nothing in this paragraph shall be construed to authorize the appropriate Federal banking agency to require a vote of members of a mutual holding company to approve one or more dividend waivers or to place any additional restrictions on dividend waivers by mutual holding companies that are inconsistent with or exceed the requirements set forth in this paragraph.
